snippet: Poland’s economy was the only one that did not shrink in 2009, the year the financial crisis hit hardest. Now, austerity measures in Europe threaten to crimp the country’s growth.
abstract: Poland’s economy is the only one in Europe that did not shrink in 2009, the year the financial crisis hit hardest, but new austerity measures in the European Union threaten its growth trend; growth is forecast at 2.7 percent this year, the fastest in the EU, after expanding by 15.8 percent from 2008 to 2011.
lead_paragraph: Poland’s economy was the only one that did not shrink in 2009, the year the financial crisis hit hardest. Now, austerity measures in Europe threaten to crimp the country’s growth.

headline.seo: Economic Gloom in Europe Barely Touches Poland
headline.main: Economic Gloom in Europe Barely Touches Proud Poland
headline.print_headline: Economic Gloom in Europe Barely Touches Proud Poland
